More than 130 cars, stretching the width of a giant bridge.
Eyewitnesses describing a kind of chain reaction.
Ten minutes of crash after crash after crash and the fog was being blamed.
And then in China, a traffic jam 60 miles long now entering its third week.
Drivers could only move 1/3 of a mile a day.
They bought instant noodles from villagers peddling food on the roadside.
The gridlock caused by construction and expected to last until September 17.
